trends.name: 2026 is the New 2016
trends.description: Users post lo-fi filtered throwbacks to 2016, like Snapchat puppy filters, Pokémon Go pics, and Vine-era vibes, captioned to evoke nostalgia for a 'simpler' time. Celebrities like Selena Gomez, Charlie Puth, John Legend, and Reese Witherspoon join with personal 10-year-old photos and videos. It marks the 10-year anniversary amid post-holiday longing for optimism pre-pandemic.
trends.viral_metric: 452% surge in '2016' searches on TikTok first week; 56M videos with hazy filter; #2016 in 1M+ TikTok posts, 37M+ Instagram posts[1][3]
trends.marketability: High - Nostalgia drives fashion recreations, filter apps, and retro merch tie-ins

trends.name: Lock-In Mindset
trends.description: Teens share public commitments to study habits, fitness goals, and routines with tribe accountability for motivation. Content features shared hacks, humor, and normalization of post-holiday grind pressure. It shifts from escapism to grounded presence and emotional validation.
trends.marketability: High - Perfect for productivity apps, gym wear, planners targeting Gen Z self-improvement

trends.name: Hygiene Rituals
trends.description: Creators elevate basic hygiene into luxurious self-care moments, turning routines into intentional self-elevation content. Focuses on everyday maintenance as a vibe shift from basic to premium. Resonates with realism over polished perfection.
trends.marketability: High - Ideal for skincare, bath products, and wellness brand collabs

trends.name: Job Life Real Talk
trends.description: Highlights realities of office returns and non-traditional careers, evolving from #worklife discussions. Creators redefine modern work with honest BTS moments over curated feeds. Ties into craving unfiltered stories.
trends.marketability: Medium - Appeals to career apps, remote work tools, but niche for teens

trends.name: Comment React Stack
trends.description: Users stack photo reactions in TikTok comments, reviving memes and creating a visual language in comment sections. Turns comments into playful community spaces like clubhouses. Brands like Oreo riff on it for engagement.
trends.viral_metric: Oreo +12% share increase via comment culture[4]
trends.marketability: High - Brands can boost interaction; meme revival kits marketable

trends.name: What to Wear Crowdsource
trends.description: Creators ask commenters for outfit advice via search bar for any occasion, from dress codes to spotlight steals. Builds community curation of personal style. Reflects curiosity-driven discovery journeys.
trends.marketability: High - Fashion brands can sponsor polls, AR try-ons

trends.name: Cooking Hacks Expansion
trends.description: Starts with recipes but expands to game days, reunions, showcasing skills in social contexts. Turns kitchen tips into versatile life hacks. Fuels intentional content over endless scroll.
trends.marketability: High - Kitchen gadgets, meal kits for viral challenges

trends.name: My Makeup Type Search
trends.description: Users query TikTok search for personalized makeup types, aesthetics, books based on past content. Harnesses algorithm for self-discovery. Part of deeper curiosity detours.
trends.marketability: High - Beauty brands for personalized quizzes, products

trends.name: January Dance Compilations
trends.description: Compilations of fast-paced dances to trending sounds like 'Hella Bad' and 'I'mma Let Her,' with moves like button holds and running back vibes. Viral challenges from TikTok, IG, YouTube. Hooks Gen Z with lit energy post-holidays.
trends.viral_metric: Multiple parts trending Jan 2026, daily new comps[2]
trends.marketability: High - Dancewear, sound-alike tracks for brands

trends.name: 2016 Eyebrow Throwback
trends.description: Subset of nostalgia: intensely carved 2016 eyebrows with puppy Snapchat filters in carousels. Users dig archives for bold beauty looks. Ties into broader 2016 recap fever.
trends.marketability: Medium - Brow products, filter apps revival

trends.name: Pokémon Go Nostalgia Pics
trends.description: Grainy iPhone shots of 2016 Pokémon Go hunts shared in feeds. Laments Vine shutdown and simpler mobile gaming era. Fuels rose-tinted decade recaps.
trends.marketability: Medium - Gaming merch, AR filter tie-ins

trends.name: Mannequin Challenge Revival
trends.description: Nod to Rae Sremmurd’s 2016 hit inspiring frozen poses in throwbacks. Users recreate with modern twists in nostalgia vids. Highlights pop culture peaks.
trends.marketability: Low - Niche, but challenge kits possible

trends.name: Bleached Hair Coachella Vibes
trends.description: Taylor Swift's 2016 bleached hair debuts recreated or shared from archives. Festival fashion throwbacks in carousels. Captures music fest optimism.
trends.marketability: High - Hair dye, festival apparel

trends.name: NPC Mode Rejection
trends.description: Ditching tired 'non-player character' autopilot tag for main character energy. Pushes intentional living over mindless scrolling. Evolves from dated trends.
trends.marketability: Medium - Motivation journals, energy drinks

trends.name: Second Account Freedom
trends.description: Brands/creators show unfiltered sides on alt accounts, breaking molds. Aligns with Reali-Tea honesty over perfection. Builds niche communities.
trends.marketability: High - Dual-persona brand strategies

trends.name: Post-Holiday Introspective Edits
trends.description: Wave of structured, reflective content amid chaos, like routine resets. Blends nostalgia with forward focus. Kicked off January trends.
trends.marketability: Medium - Journaling apps, reset kits

trends.name: Hella Bad Dance Move
trends.description: Signature dance from comps: 'Hella bad, just ask if she could hold the button' lip-syncs with fast twists. High-energy Gen Z challenge.
trends.marketability: High - Viral sound for ads

trends.name: Scuba Junior Lip-Sync
trends.description: 'I'm the junior scuba' hooks in dance vids with confident struts. Part of lit challenge series. Quick-spread audio.
trends.marketability: Medium - Meme audio merch

trends.name: Lemonade Beyoncé Throwbacks
trends.description: 2016 Beyoncé Lemonade visuals and tour clips in nostalgia posts. Celebrates album drop amid year recaps. Iconic culture nod.
trends.marketability: High - Music streams, visual albums

trends.name: We Don’t Talk Anymore Lip-Sync
trends.description: Charlie Puth's 2016 hit revived with original vid recreations. Radio dominance nostalgia in low-fi edits. Hooks emotional callbacks.
trends.marketability: Medium - Throwback playlists
